The code is generally well-structured and readable. It follows standard Java conventions and includes basic getter and setter methods. However, the method name 'string()' is not intuitive and could be renamed to 'getString()' for consistency. Additionally, the class extends Object unnecessarily as all classes in Java implicitly extend Object.
